cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.NE. 

This paper deals with the problem of text summarization, which is a subfield of natural language processing (NLP) and falls under the category of Computational Linguistics (cs.CL). The paper proposes a model modification for news headline generation, which involves the use of a copying mechanism to handle new named entities and morphologically rich languages. This modification involves the use of machine learning techniques such as neural networks, which are commonly used in the subfields of Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) and Machine Learning (cs.LG). The paper also evaluates the performance of the proposed model using the ROUGE metric, which is commonly used in Information Retrieval (cs.IR) and Natural Language Processing (cs.CL). Finally, the paper discusses the limitations and future directions of the proposed model, which involves the use of reinforcement learning techniques, which are commonly used in the subfield of Neural Networks (cs.NE).
